intro: Bulbinella burkei, commonly known as the rock lily, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Bulbinella burkei is often found in coastal and inland regions, growing in full sun to partial shade.
